name: places/ChIJdYUHM9tZwokRjtaaNz5uwuM
adrFormatAddress: 21 1st Ave., New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
Such a cute atmosphere inside, with well-priced and well-portioned sandwiches. We got the chicken parm (bread was phenomenal, chicken delicious and not too oily, great proportion of cheese/sauce as well) and the Ricky which was unlike any other broccoli rabe sandwich I’ve had before (a huge pile of broccoli rabe cooked in a pan with the sausage, really soft semolina bread).

The quality of ingredients is amazing, but the folks at Lil Frankie’s Grocery were the best. The chef checked in on us through the window while we were sitting outside and even gave us sodas, which made our day! John was also so hospitable and friendly, we loved chatting with him.

Will definitely be back again to try every sandwich on the menu, and will need to come grab a late night grandma slice at some point!

originalText.text: The place is awesome, with a beautiful interior, super friendly atmo, and great sandwiches. I tried a roast beef sandwich, which was very simple with tomato, lettuce, and sauce, and without additional ingredients and heavy flavors. It reminded me of simple and spontaneously prepared homemade sandwiches, we all love. The manager is very friendly, communicative, and attentive to the customers. I’m going to return and try other sandwiches from the menu as well.

originalText.text:
We had insanely delicious sandwiches there and their Italian lemonades where the perfect drink to it. And the vibe in there was also amazing and the guy serving us was so nice too.

Will def come a 100 times more, a beyond meat or vegan chicken Sandwich would be amazing tho.

originalText.text:
a bacon, egg, & cheese on a roll is an essential part of the NYC food experience, so it’s no surprise that Lil’ Frankie’s Italian spin on the classic breakfast sandwich is an essential order at the narrow sandwich shop. "The Fran" is the sando’s name and consists of eggs, crispy guanciale, fontina cheese, & arugula on a Ciabatta roll. this sandwich is a great mix of flavors from silky smoothness of the eggs fried in olive oil to the salty salty sweet fattiness of the guanciale (pig’s cheeks) to the sharpness of the fontina cheese to the peppery slight bitterness of the arugula—all sandwiched in a crusty ciabatta roll with a soft chewy inside. while nothing will replace a classic bacon egg & cheese, this is a worthy order for something off-the-beaten-path.

Lil’ Frankie’s Grocery serves a sandwich menu during the day and then a pizza-centric menu at night. there are Italian-groceries like olive oils, tomato sauces, pastas, etc. in the narrow space. there is a large communal table for seating. the small deli space upfront is where the sandwiches are made. service is quick and friendly.

originalText.text: Sandwiches were excellent, little arugula salads were included as a pleasant surprise. The front of house staff were so kind and attentive even though I was just doing a pick up order. Will definitely be coming back
